clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of LAS41003 in the Treatment of Inflammatory Tinea Pedis
clinical_study.official_title: Phase IIa, Two-center, Randomized, Double Blind Study With Parallel Groups to Evaluate the Anti-mycotic and Anti-inflammatory Efficacy of Topical Combinational Product LAS 41003 Versus Corresponding Mono-substances in Patients With Inflammatory Tinea Pedis

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine the efficacy and safety of a topical application of the combinational cream LAS41003 compared to application of its mono-substances after once daily treatment in patients with inflammatory tinea pedis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical assessment scores and mycological status of fungi (KOH test and mycological culture)

secondary_outcome.measure: Physicians assessment of signs and symptoms (erythema, scaling, vesicles, pustules, crusting, fissuring and maceration)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of locla skin reactions, AEs
